title: Wall Street Still Isn’t Buying Snap’s Surprising Turnaround
text:
Shares of social media (and tech spectacles) company Snap were already heading lower in early 2018 when celebrity Kylie Jenner wondered whether anyone else had stopped using the Snapchat app because of the much-maligned redesign.

Among Snap skeptics, Jenner’s tweet was a harbinger of impending doom for the company—and its stock. Indeed, Snap (ticker: SNAP) shares lost some two-thirds of their value by the end of last year. But the reports of Snap’s death, to paraphrase another noted American influencer, were greatly exaggerated....
description: A year ago, Snap shares were tumbling, and the company was losing sway with some of its most important users. Then the stock started to rise—a rally few saw coming.
